attributes.action: Review the rates of vehicle tax charged on motorbikes, with a view to reduce.
attributes.additional_details: I own a motorbike over 600cc, & the tax cost is £93 pa. I own a 1.5 diesel car that is £30 pa tax. My son has a 1200cc petrol car that is £30pa tax. There does seem to be a mismatch here!!  As motorbikes are not tested for emissions, how were these rates set? Have they ever been reviewed? I would suggest the sulution is to test a range of different cc bikes & see what the actual polution rates are, & then reduce the banded rates accordingly. I would be very interested to see the results.
attributes.background: Motorbikes are not currently tested for emissions, unlike cars, but seem to be taxed at a high rate, & are not big polluters. I am not sure how the current level of tax was established, but it seems very high when compared to cars. I would like to see a reduction based on polution levels.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333461
